column4: I am trying to mount an HFSplus drive read/write on ubuntu server and I get an error     mount: unknown filesystem type 'users'
how do I resolve it?
what command line are you using?
paste your /etc/fstab ina pastebin please
http://pastebin.com/m1ffe46a0
http://pastebin.com/m2d436c1e there is an space between the file system type hfsplus and the options
you forgot it
i suspect that the udf entry is wrong too? did you hand edited it ?
well put an space there too
well I don't get an error now when I sudo mount -a  but the filesystem is still read only when I attempt to create a file on it with vi
thoughts?
paste the output of "cat /proc/mounts"
ok  *pasting*
http://pastebin.com/m4d2d44aa   (pasted cat /proc/mounts)
it got mounted read only dunno why /dev/sdb1 /media/ExternalHD hfsplus ro,nosuid,nodev,noexec,umask=22,uid=0,gid=0,nls=utf8 0 0
note the ro
so do I have this configured correctly    it is just not working as expected?
please continue this with Guiri he also has access to this system
most nic are suported out of the box. you only have to configure the corresponding iface via /etc/network/interfaces ( man interfaces )
/usr/share/pixmaps/ ?
cool thanks....I'm actually finding the vmware ones  in /usr/lib/vmware/share/pixmaps    I did a locate *.xpm | grep vm*   and have found them
if it is an iso it will be in a /dev/loop? device
hmm ok I'll try to mount it to a directory  thanks
